name: ENERGY STAR Res. ASHP (RST)
_description: Standard size residential air source heat pump that meets the ENERGY STAR performance standard, non-cold-climate, replace resistance

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical measure penetration is captured in baseline

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Split system (see table 2); conversion from original standard: COP = SEER / 3.412, COP = HSPF / 3.412 (see EIA source)

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements for Central Air-Conditioners and Heat Pumps, v6
Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014

installed_cost_source.notes: Installed costs for best ASHP in 2017

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Grid-Interactive Efficient Building Technology Cost, Performance, and Lifetime Characteristics
source_data.author: Nubbe et al. 2020

product_lifetime_source.notes: Median of average ENERGY STAR lifetime in 2017

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

central AC.title: RECS 2015 - Table HC6.1
central AC.fraction_derivation: Central AC multiple of 40.5% was determined as the proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling in the sample is 76,090,522, and then filtered for homes with electric heating system (76,090,522 - 45,241,958 fuel-fired systems).

market_scaling_fractions_source.resistance heat: Applies to all homes with electric resistance furnaces (the resistance heat tech. is indicative of a forced air electric furnace in the EIA data)
